poem:
### Downtown Protest

In the city of angels,  
echoes of hooves dance on cracked asphalt,  
a curfew ushers quiet like a final curtain.  
Voices once woven together unravel,  
as night steps in, heavy and uninvited,  
where protest met with steel resolve,  
leaves only the moon to witness  
this assembly's quiet dissolution.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Riot police disperse protesters in downtown LA – as it happened 6.11am BST This blog is closing now. You can read all our coverage of the anti-Ice protests in Los Angeles and across the US here. In the meantime, here are the key developments in US politics: A curfew has come into effect for the second consecutive night in downtown Los Angeles, where police used horses and munitions to disperse protesters. Police declared the gathering". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Riot police disperse protesters in downtown LA – as it happened 6.11am BST This blog is closing now.
